feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 6:46AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN THROUGH THE DAYTIME MONDAY... A front with an embedded surface low is tracking over the region. Wind gusts of 50 to 60 mph and periods of heavy rain with total amounts as high as 2 inches are expected. Peak winds and rain will occur with the front over the southern half of the panhandle during the daylight hours. Behind the front, a wind shift to the

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 6:36AM AKST until November 21 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 11:13AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Increased Wildfire Risk Today... The combination of relative humidity values in the 20-30 percent range, wind gusts of 15 to 20 mph, and dry 10-hr fuel moisture will result in a more favorable environment for wildfires this afternoon. The limiting factor for a higher threat are highs in the upper 40s and weak moisture transport from the south.

entry.summary: ...Elevated Fire Threat This Afternoon... Gusty winds up to 25 to 30+ mph in addition to relative humidity values dropping into the upper teens to lower 20s will lead to an elevated fire threat through the afternoon and early evening hours. entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE DANGER TODAY... An elevated fire danger exists for portions of northern Ohio today due to a combination of south to southwest winds of 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 35 to 40 mph, minimum relative humidity values of 20 to 30 percent, and dry fuels. The elevated fire risk does not include areas that currently have snow on the ground.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 10:11AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER THIS AFTERNOON... A combination of dry vegetation, relative humidity lowering to around 20 to 25%, and winds gusting to around 15 to 25 mph will result in increased fire danger today. Fires that start today could spread quickly; therefore, outdoor burning is not recommended.
